title: Generation of human iPSCs from urine derived cells of patient with a novel heterozygous PAI-1 mutation.
abstract: We have generated a human induced pluripotent stem cell (iPSC) line under feeder-free culture conditions using the urine derived cells (UCs) collected from subjects heterozygous for a novel Plasminogen Activator Inhibitor-1 (PAI-1) mutation. The Sendai Virus (SeV) vector encoding pluripotent Yamanaka transcription factors was used at a low multiplicity of infection to reprogram the PAI-1 UCs.
